Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. The shooting looks like a cheap Howie Mandell comedy, no one is edited to look like a supermodel, and there are some ridiculous scenarios you'd think they were scripted by a bunch of giggling teenagers watching gay porn. Yet I was swept up in the vibe, though.
The movie begins in modern-day Southern California.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: the beginning consists of an adult Miyazawa who has died and finds his past tormentor, Miura Shokichi.
